snippet: President Obama meets with President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico as both leaders seek to shift attention from security issues  to the vast economic relationship between the two nations.
abstract: Pres Obama and Pres Enrique Pena Nieto of Mexico avoid topics of immigration overhaul in United States and Mexican efforts to confront drug violence during hourlong news conference after private meeting; choose instead to focus on economic relationship between nations.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

lead_paragraph: President Obama meets with President Enrique Peña Nieto of Mexico as both leaders seek to shift attention from security issues  to the vast economic relationship between the two nations.

headline.seo: Obama Meets With Mexican President Enrique Peña Nieto
headline.main: Obama Arrives in Mexican Capital to Meet With New Leader
headline.print_headline: Tiptoeing As Leader Of Mexico Meets Obama
